citation.title: Report: increases in police use of force in the presence of body-worn cameras are driven by officer discretion: a protocol-based subgroup analysis of ten randomized experiments

news.title: Police Body Cameras Reduce Use Of Force, If Cops Can’t Turn Them Off
news.summary: A new study of more than 2,000 police officers aims to determine how much they actually reduce force by officers In the age of high-profile police shootings, body cameras are meant to be an antidote—a way to create transparency and accountability on…

news.title: Cops Wearing Body Cameras Are More Likely to Be Assaulted
news.summary: A large-scale analysis of body-camera usage among police officers in the US and the UK has produced some rather unexpected and counter-intuitive results, showing that body-worn cameras have a tendency to increase assaults on police.

news.title: Cops Wearing Body Cameras Are More Likely to Be Assaulted
news.summary: LAPD out on patrol. (Image: Chris Yarzab) A large-scale analysis of body-camera usage among police officers in the US and the UK has produced some rather unexpected and counter-intuitive results, showing that body-worn cameras have a tendency to…

news.title: Cops Wearing Body Cameras Are More Likely To Be Assaulted
news.summary: A large-scale analysis of body-camera usage among police officers in the US and the UK has produced some rather unexpected and counter-intuitive results, showing that body-worn cameras have a tendency to increase assaults on police.

news.title: Body-worn cameras associated with increased assaults against police, and increase in use-of-force if officers choose when to activate cameras
news.summary: New evidence from the largest-yet series of experiments on use of body-worn cameras by police has revealed that rates of assault against police by members of the public actually increased when officers wore the cameras.

news.title: Body-worn cameras associated with increased assaults against police, and increase in use-of-force if officers choose when to activate cameras

blogs.title: Complaints against police plummet in presence of body cams, says new study
blogs.summary: A recent spate of violence between police officers and citizens in the United States has raised many questions about what happens when an organization meant to protect its populace harms it instead. As with so many quandaries these days, technology

blogs.title: Scientists Hunt Hard Evidence On How Cop Cameras Affect Behavior
blogs.summary: Police departments in about 95 percent of cities nationally have put wearable cameras on officers, or soon plan to. But do these body cameras make neighborhoods safer? Scientists want to find out.(Image credit: Win McNamee/Getty Images)
